title: @Riot Are older Legendary skins getting updates?
body:
I recently noticed that the new 975 skins coming out with recall animations and some special effects; I feel as the old skins started losing their spark. Don't get me wrong, I like the history behind these skins. But putting this into perspective, if Gentleman Cho'gath was released today, it would probably be sold either as a 975 or a 1350 skin. 

I can honestly see on a marketing perspective as of why you wouldn't update these skins. But I feel as if the incoming new players would feel more attracted to these skins if given a bit more attention.

Gentlman Cho'gath is absolutely my favorite skin in league though. And I would find it amazing if he had a recall animation where he would sit down on a crimson early 1900's couch, taking a sip on his favorite Noxian Blend of tea while listening to the finest classical music.

Here are my questions to** Riot:**

**Have you thought about or considered going back and working on the original legendary skins?**

**What impact does changing  the old skins have on new players vs more experience players?**

**What does changing aspects of old skins mean to new sales rather than newer ones?**

**Would changing aspects of skins affect the perception of players in a negative way?**

**What do these older skins mean to you as person who works at Riot games?**

**If newer players asked you 'Why would I buy these skins?' what would you answer?**

If you do take time to read and answer these questions,

Thank you!
